head.title: In This Battle, No Shots Fired in Anger

hedline.hl1: In This Battle, No Shots Fired in Anger

abstract.p: More than 2,000 re-enactors mark 225th anniversary of Battle of White Plains at Ward Pound Reservation in Cross River, NY; photos (M)

block.p: EVERYTHING looked authentic except for the minivans that hauled in the artillery, the portable bathrooms and the video cameras that seemed as common as canteens. Assembled at Ward Pound Ridge Reservation in Cross River were more than 2,000 re-enactors, all in Revolutionary War era regalia to mark the 225th anniversary of the Battle of White Plains. For two days last weekend they bivouacked and battled and provided visitors with a living history of the era and the battle, where 1,500 of Washington's Continentals stalled the advance of several thousand British troops.

While the battle was refought on Sunday, 20 miles south at a park in White Plains, the actual battle site, the date was marked by the dedication of a new flagpole and interpretive signs.
